Class BlockNBTHandler

java.lang.Object
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.nbt.NBTHandler<de.tr7zw.changeme.nbtapi.NBTCompound>
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.nbt.FriendSupportingHandler<de.tr7zw.changeme.nbtapi.NBTCompound>
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.nbt.BlockNBTHandler
public final class BlockNBTHandler extends FriendSupportingHandler<de.tr7zw.changeme.nbtapi.NBTCompound>
A block handler to get values and settings from a single lockable block.
Since:
0.2.3

    • BlockNBTHandler

      public BlockNBTHandler(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.block.Block block) throws RuntimeException
      Create a new handler for given block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block we want to use and get the NBT container for.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if block is not a lockable block or lockable tile entity.
      Since:
      0.2.3

  • Method Details

    • getOwner

      @NotNull public @NotNull String getOwner()
      Reads the current owner from the NBT container.
      Returns:
      The owner as a UUID-String read from the container, or an empty String.
      Since:
      0.2.3

    • setOwner

      public void setOwner(@NotNull @NotNull String owner)
      Set the current owner of this block.

      Important: After calling this method, you should call applyToOtherContainer() to sync the owner data to the other half of double chests/doors.

      Parameters:
      owner - The new owner for this block. Should be a valid UUID.
      Since:
      0.2.3

    • getRedstoneHandler

      @NotNull public @NotNull RedstoneSettingsHandler getRedstoneHandler()
      Gets the redstone settings handler for this block. Will remap any legacy redstone settings to the new system.
      Returns:
      The redstone settings handler.
      Since:
      0.4.13

    • isNotProtected

      public boolean isNotProtected()
      Whether or not this block is protected. This is evaluated by checking if an owner exists and if any friends have been added to the block.
      Returns:
      True, if this block is not protected and there is no owner.
      Since:
      0.2.3

    • isProtected

      public boolean isProtected()
      Returns:

    • canAccess

      public boolean canAccess(@NotNull @NotNull FriendHandler friend)
      Checks whether given friend can access this block. This does not guarantee that the friend is also allowed to manage the block or take items from it.
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend to check for.
      Returns:
      True, if player is allowed to access this block.

    • modifyFriends

      @NotNull public @NotNull de.dei0.blockprot.nbt.LockReturnValue modifyFriends(@NotNull @NotNull String player, @NotNull @NotNull String friend, @NotNull @NotNull de.dei0.blockprot.nbt.FriendModifyAction action)
      Modifies the friends of this block for given action.
      Parameters:
      player - The player requesting this command, should be the owner.
      friend - The friend do to action with.
      action - The action we should perform with friend on this block.
      Returns:
      A LockReturnValue whether or not the friends were modified successfully.
      Since:
      0.4.6

    • applyToOtherContainer

      public void applyToOtherContainer()
      Since:
      0.4.6
      See Also:
      • applyToOtherContainer(Predicate, Consumer)

    • applyToOtherContainer

      public void applyToOtherContainer(@NotNull @NotNull Predicate<BlockNBTHandler> condition, @NotNull @NotNull Consumer<BlockNBTHandler> orElse)
      This applies any changes to this container to a possible other half. For example doors consist from two blocks, as do double chests. Without this call, all methods will modify only the local, current block.

      This method is specifically not called on each modification of NBT, as this would be a massive, unnecessary performance penalty.

      Parameters:
      condition - A predicate defining whether the data should be merged over from the given BlockNBTHandler.
      orElse - If condition is not true, this function can be used as a callback when applying fails.
      Since:
      0.4.10

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all values from this block and resets it to the defaults.
      Since:
      0.3.2

    • mergeHandler

      public void mergeHandler(@NotNull @NotNull NBTHandler<?> handler)
      Merges this handler with another NBTHandler.
      Overrides:
      mergeHandler in class NBTHandler<de.tr7zw.changeme.nbtapi.NBTCompound>
      Parameters:
      handler - The handler to merge with. If handler is not an instance of BlockNBTHandler, this will do nothing.
      Since:
      0.3.2
